instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
Hi, i don't get the precise green light that the Magsafe is not original this is what i have:
L7095   3.43V
L7130  12.25V
L7195 5.50V
L3095 0V
L7720  0V 
L7710  0V
L7520  0V
L7630  0V
L7430  0V
L7310  0V
L7320  0V
L7330  0V

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
Check SMC_RESET_L first.
Be sure to use 85W Magsafe 2 charger.

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: SMC_RESET_L= 3.38v

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS?
Post Y5110 DC voltage, if not o-scope available.

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
3V3_S5/SUS= 0V
Y5110 DC voltage ON PIN 1 IS 1.40V PIN 3 1,22 V

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: SMC_PM_G2_EN comes on?

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: nothing, however, I begin to suspect that it is the adapter unfortunately I do not have the same head for the counter one

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: I fixed a connector to power everything, I checked SMC and it seems to work I switched to u7100 and on ACIN I have 4.69v and on SMC_BC_ACOK I have 3v the ACIN value seems high to me, shouldn't it be 3.2V?

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
Is good enough, if you get correct SMC_BC_ACOK.
Try known good SMC...

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: But is there more than one version of this logic board? Because the scheme is slightly different

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
There is no boardview available for 00138; can use 00163 instead, with some differences.
Be aware of schematics; X425G is for 00163 and X425 for 00138.

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: I downloaded 00163 and realized that there was no capacitor near SMC or C3550 (on 00163 boardview that corresponds to reality) and it was short-circuited. Then while I was checking U7100 I touched C7102 with C7116 and I had to replace U7100, all as before but I have low insulation on PP3V42_BUS is now 3.29V. Do I need to replace SMC? Would 00163 possibly be fine?[ATTACH type="full"]60372[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground at 3V42_G3H power rail.
What voltages do you get on the board now?
Which is the exact symptom?

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
PP3V42_BUS_G3 = 3.30v
PP_BUS_G3= 12.23
SMC_RESET_L= 0,831v
SMC_BC_ACOK= 3,00v
Post diode mode 3V42_G3H= 0,025

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
Dificil to understand why using these names for the first two lines.

"SMC_RESET_L= 0,831v"
That is bad enough; unless you've meant diode mode, not voltage.
REMEMBER, do NOT write the end "V" after diode mode reading.

Something damaged on 3V42_G3H; diode mode reading is too low.
However not so low to use voltage injection.
You can remove SMC aand check the value again.
If still low, something else is the culprit.

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: Can I use 00163 SMC looks the same

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
Get SMC from 00138 board.
The one from 00163 may cause video issues.

BTW, did you check what I said above?

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: Before removing SMC I took a look at the power dc and noticed this, I don't own another can I fix it? What is it?

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: Is that DCIN board?

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: Yes, his

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: Change with known good one.

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: I removed SMC but the short remains, pp3v42 diode mode is 0.035

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: Lift L7095 and check where the low value remains.

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: it stays on pin 2 of L7095

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
Many chips connected there, not easy job.
Inspect U1900/50, U3740, U7001, U4650, U4850, U5110, J5250, J6100 for coorosion.
If nothing strange, then remove one by one and check diode mode reading each time.

Also take a look at filter caps placed on 3V42_G3H.

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: I removed U1900 and the value rose to 0.109 and he is the culprit

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
The board works now?
When board is cooled down, usual value is approx 0.300 at 3V42_G3H.

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: I have to reball the smc and replace u 1900

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: Here I am! So I reballed to SMC now I get ppbus_g3 and 3v42, it starts for 5 seconds and then stops. So for 3 times, and I have orange light even with the battery not connected

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
Did you try SMC bypass?
Get known good battery for test in normal way; these boards may have weird issues without battery.

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: Does it work there is the dong there is no backlight but OS X charge is it the spi rom?

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
Is not BIOS problem.
If board stays on in SMC bypass, must a problem with some I/V sensor.
Check first if AVREF_SMC is present.

Remember to use 85W Magsafe 2 charger!!!

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: AVREF_SMC is present

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
Start the board in SMC bypass mode and check all I/VSENSE outputs from page 44.
Post their levels here.

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: I wanted to bypass with pads near the keyboard connector and now I'm in the starting situation again pp_bus 12.25 and pp3v42 and 3.36 but on pin 2 of L7095 first it's normal

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
I'm not sure about what you mean with L7095.

If board stays on, check what I've said.
Start with C5414/21/41.

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: Unfortunately I don't get the green light and the fan doesn't turn Ppbus_g3 remains at 12.25 and pp3v42 3.37 pin 2 of l7095 I get: smc_bc_acok, smc_reset_l pp1v2_s5_smc, I checked the pull-up resistors and the crystal, is bad SMC ?

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
Is normal to lose green light on SMC bypass mode.
But fans should start with full speed.

Do you get again low resistance to ground at L7095?
Post the exact value in diode mode (red to ground).

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: I don't think the L7095 is 0.341 diode mode, I don't even get the SMC bypass and green light anymore

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: Post again basic voltages; 3V42_G3H, PPBUS_G3H, SMC_RESET_L, 3V3_S5.

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: Post U7000 and Y5110 DC voltages.

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
Are you using original Magsafe 2 charger for sure?
Test with known good DCIN board.

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: Yes, why?

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: If already tried known good DCIN board, then change SMC...

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: I replaced SMC, but now it has problems at startup the battery is detected but it is not charged, is it u7100?

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: Did you use 00138 SMC?

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: Correct

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
What is exact PPBUS_G3H w/ and w/o battery connected?
Of course, charger must be always connected.

If not good, check voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: Same voltage with and without connected battery 12.57

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message:
First be sure battery is good, or test with known good one.
If still the same, change U7100.
Solder another SMC as last option.

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: When it enters the operational theme if it tells me that the battery has 86 cycles, can it also depend on a bad welding of the SMC?

threads.title: 820-00138 no power no green light
threads.message: I checked SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA with the oscilloscope there is communication, so SMC should be ok now I try to replace the dc in and then I try with U7100
